climbs.name: Truck Stop Crank
climbs.fa: B. Gartland, T. Reid, K. Pohl

content.description: 4 bolts lead up the steep clean face on thin holds and perfect rock.  The crux is moving past the third bolt.  Shares chain anchors with Mini Thins.  Rappel or down climb 3rd Class terrain to the south.

Currently the right most route at the Truck Stop.  Ascend a left-angling crack past several bulges to the ledge with chain anchors.  Probably one of the first climbs done in this area of the Stonewall and not all that good.  Take care with the large block about 20 feet off the ground, it's big and precarious.

climbs.name: Pay Before you Pump
climbs.fa: B. Gartland, K. Pohl, T. Barton, V. Magnis, Ronin

content.description: Another trad line that begins approx. 20' left of Mini Thins and ascends a short face to a triangle shaped block to a short right facing dihedral.  Take gear for the belay.  To descend traverse right and rappel from the Mini Thins/Truck Stop Crank anchor or down climb 3rd Class terrain to the south.

An easy left leaning ramp leads to a right leaning finger crack that shares an anchor with Truck Stop Crank.  Shares the same blocky start as _Crank_ but then cuts left up the ramp after 12 feet.  Rappel or down climb 3rd Class terrain to the south.

A fun tour along the spine of the Stonewall.  In places the route follows a narrow catwalk with exciting exposure and great views of the surrounding peaks.  Begin on the 3rd Class ramps and ledges just right of the Truck Stop routes and continue north to the end of the crag.
content.protection: Light rack and/or sticky rubber.  To my knowledge this has only been done without a rope so I don't have much to suggest regarding gear.
content.location: The route is a continuation of the scramble used to reach the Truck Stop anchors on the West face of the Stonewall.

content.description: The line on the right side of the Ripplemark Wall that heads straight up steep but moderate rock on fun but spooky flakes and edges.  Most of the dubious holds are probably gone but the belayer should be on the lookout and/or wear a helmet.  At last visit the anchor only consisted of two hangers, one slightly suspect; rappel or down climb off the back.

Follows the left of the two lines on the Ripplemark Wall past 4 bolts.  The second bolt is a bit misplaced.  Rappel from the chains or down climb over the back of the lower fin and scramble south and west to the trail.
